node.title: A woman who fled a remote community in hard lockdown has tested positive. Here's what we know
node.alt: Police walk through a lawn at a house block on the Victoria Highway.
node.description: Northern Territory authorities say the positive case of greatest concern at the moment is a woman who fled hard lockdown in the remote community of Binjari, hopped into a taxi with three others and entered Katherine. Now, Katherine residents awaiting the fallout.
node.content:
["The Northern Territory's current COVID-19 outbreak today hit one of its most concerning\u00a0moments.", "Authorities said a woman from the remote community of Binjari, 16 kilometres south-west of Katherine, had\u00a0tested positive for coronavirus.", "However, when they went to find her in Binjari, which is under a hard lockdown, she was not there.", "", "
The community of Binjari is 16 kilometres south-west of Katherine.(ABC News: Kate Ashton)
", "Instead she was found in Katherine, unaware she had COVID-19, where authorities fear she was infectious for hours.", "Here's what we know about the positive case that set off a frantic police search and could have significant impacts on the Greater Katherine area where thousands are in an extended lockdown.", "
Where did the woman go?
", "The rough timeline, as presented by the Police Commissioner this morning, has the woman leaving Binjari, along with three other residents, last night.", "\"We understand it commenced under the darkness of last night,\" Commissioner Jamie Chalker said.", "He said police were now undertaking interviews and tracing possible contacts to pin down the group's exact movements.", "However,\u00a0police know the group walked to\u00a0a caravan park, called a taxi and were found by police in a public housing property along the Victoria Highway.", "", "
Police say\u00a0the woman was\u00a0found in a public housing block on the Victoria Highway.(ABC News: Jesse Thompson)
", "The ABC has spoken to the manager at Manbulloo Homestead and Caravan Park, the nearest accommodation facility\u00a0to Binjari, about 5km\u00a0away from the community.", "She said police visited the park at 8:30pm Monday night, searching for people from the community and asking if they had seen any taxis in the area.", "Despite no specific areas being identified yet, \u00a0Mr Gunner said today the woman was \"at large in Katherine [while] she was infectious\" for up to 12 hours.", "Aboriginal leaders have detailed the unique challenges presented to residents in remote communities under hard lockdowns, and police said\u00a0it was\u00a0not known why the woman breached health directions and left the community.", "
Who else is impacted?
", "Even before contact tracers identify potential exposure sites, at least 11 people are now close contacts of the woman.", "These are the three who left Binjari with the woman, all of whom could face $5,024 fines, Commissioner Chalker said.", "Seven other people from the public housing block\u00a0on the Victoria Highway where the woman was found are also now close contacts.", "The last is the taxi driver.", "\"The taxi will be off the road until it goes through a full cleanse before it can go back into operation,\" Commissioner Chalker said.", "
When did police know the group\u00a0left Binjari?
", "There is a lack of detail on the police search but Commissioner Chalker said police resources \"had to be diverted to focus on the four that left the Binjari community overnight\".", "Mr Gunner said \"every police resource on hand was thrown at this to locate the case\" once the positive test had been identified.", "
When did the woman test positive?
", "Mr Gunner said her positive test was confirmed this morning.", "The woman was then found by police just prior to 11am this morning, Commissioner Chalker said.", "
What are police doing?
", "Commissioner Chalker indicated NT Police had \"deployed more people\" to Binjari after the incident, which was the second time residents\u00a0had fled the hard lockdown area.", "\"There'll be some further [resources] going down there to make sure that we've got appropriate fatigue management in place,\" he said.", "
What is the fallout?
", "Authorities have expressed disappointment because the actions could endanger others and extend a lockdown for thousands of people in the Greater Katherine area.", "\"We now have to find out all those that she's been with and work through to at least day-five [test]\u00a0results to understand if they also are positive,\" Commissioner Chalker said.", "Restrictions in Katherine are currently set to last until at least December 4.", "\"Today's positive case may reset that clock, unfortunately, for the people of Katherine, because that's a positive case in the community,\" Mr Gunner said.", "\"It's normally 14 days from the last known potential transmission [case] in their community, so a\u00a0replication cycle [before a lockdown lifts].\"", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
"]
